alert.note: Alert for Huerfano County Including Walsenburg; Southern El Paso County Including Fort Carson and Colorado Springs (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 10 at 9:45PM MDT until April 11 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Red Flag Warning will expire at 10 PM this evening for fire weather zones 221, 222, 224 and 226 through 233, which includes the San Luis Valley, Fremont County, Teller County, the I-25 corridor, and Crowley, Otero and eastern Las Animas counties... ...Red Flag Warning remains in effect from Noon until 8 PM MDT Monday for for gusty winds and low humidity values for fire weather zones 227 through 237, which includes most of the eastern plains of southeast Colorado... ...Fire Weather Watch remains in effect for Tuesday morning through Tuesday evening for gusty winds and low humidity values for fire weather zones 228 through 237 which includes most of the eastern plains of southeast Colorado... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT MONDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 227 AND 229... ...RED FLAG WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 227 AND 229... * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zones 227 and 229. * Winds...South 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * Timing...Noon until 8 PM MDT Monday. * Relative Humidity...As low as 3 percent. * Impacts...Conditions will be favorable for rapid rates of fire growth and spread.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Huerfano County Including Walsenburg; Southern El Paso County Including Fort Carson and Colorado Springs
